Parent Company: Foxconn Technology Group (Hon Hai Precision Industry Company)
Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Parent Company: Foxconn Technology Group (Hon Hai Precision Industry Company)
Description: Three leading electronics manufacturers -- LG Display Co. Ltd., Sharp Corp. and Chunghwa Picture Tubes Ltd. -- agreed to plead guilty and pay a total of $585 million in criminal fines for their roles in conspiracies to fix prices in the sale of liquid crystal display (LCD) panels.

Parent Company: Foxconn Technology Group (Hon Hai Precision Industry Company)

Company: Hon Hai Precision Industry Company Ltd. And E-Star Inc.
Parent Company: Foxconn Technology Group (Hon Hai Precision Industry Company)
Foxconn Technology Group (Hon Hai Precision Industry Company)
Description: Attorney General Bob Ferguson announced settlements totaling $44 million from seven liquid crystal display (LCD) manufacturers accused of engaging in a price-fixing conspiracy that drove up prices consumers paid on items like TVs, laptops and cell phones.

Parent Company: Foxconn Technology Group (Hon Hai Precision Industry Company)
Description: Seven manufacturers of flat screen LCD (Liquid Crystal Display) panels agreed to pay more than $500 million to settle multistate price-fixing allegations.

Parent Company: Foxconn Technology Group (Hon Hai Precision Industry Company)
Description: LG Electronics, Panasonic, Samsung, Sharp and Sony agreed to pay a total of $1.25 million and contribute $1.125 million of audio-visual equipment to Californian schools and institutions in settlement of allegations by District Attorney Offices in seven counties that they violated state law by stating TV screen sizes rounded to the nearest inch. The announcement did not specify how much each company would pay. Here we assume the amounts were divided equally among the five.
